article.title: One-Dimensional Symmetry Protected Topological Phases and their Transitions

choices: The relationship between the 2-chain and four different SPT models.
The energy spectrum of the 2-chain compared to the other models.
The mapping of the 2-chain to a single Kitaev chain.
The effect of symmetry transformations on the 2-chain.
Different energy levels of the α-chain Hamiltonian.
The structure of the α-chain for different values of α.
The mapping of the α-chain to the cluster model.
The effect of symmetry transformations on the α-chain.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is depicted in this figure?
choices: The SSH model with fermionic edge modes for λ>1/2.
The Kitaev chain with Majorana edge modes.
The cluster model with its degenerate edge modes.
The α-chain with its long-range Majorana couplings.
The AKLT model with its alternating spin-1 projectors.
The bipartite Hubbard chain with single occupancy.
The 2-chain with its Majorana edge modes.
The generalized cluster model with α=3.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is illustrated in this figure?
choices: The SSH model in its dimerized phase.
The cluster state in its ground state configuration.
The fixed point limit of the AKLT state.
The ground state of the bipartite Hubbard model in the Mott limit.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this phase diagram depict?
choices: The effect of interactions on the Hamiltonian H_ferm.
The phase diagram for the non-interacting Hamiltonian H_ferm.
The connection between the 4-chain and the Haldane phase.
The transition between the Kitaev chain and the 2-chain.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this phase diagram show?
choices: The phase transitions of the non-interacting α-chain model.
The phase diagram for the interacting Hamiltonian H_ferm with the interaction term V.
The stability of the Haldane phase under charge fluctuations.
The transition between the cluster model and the trivial phase.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is illustrated in this phase diagram?
choices: The phase diagram of Hamiltonian (25) without interactions.
The phase diagram for the Hamiltonian (25) in the presence of specific interactions.
The effect of introducing a Z2 symmetry to the α-chain model.
The transition between two different generalized cluster models.
The phase diagram for the spin model (27), which does not correspond to any fermionic model if h_y ≠ 0.
The phase diagram for the interacting 2-chain model.
The effect of breaking sublattice symmetry in the SSH model.
The transition between the AKLT model and the trivial phase.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does this table provide?
choices: The central charges of different α-chain models.
The protected edge degeneracies and symmetry fractionalization of the α-chains for different values of α.
The mapping of the α-chain to different spin models.
The effect of the Jordan-Wigner transformation on the α-chain.
The relationship between the central charge and the edge degeneracy for different α-chains.
The different SPT phases characterized by fermionic parity symmetry and time-reversal symmetry.
The effect of interactions on the phase transitions between α-chains.
The mapping of the fermionic α-chain to spin Hamiltonians using the Jordan-Wigner transformation.
The central charge at the critical points between generalized cluster models.
The symmetry breaking and fractionalization properties of the spin chains in Table II.
The group structure of the generalized cluster models.
The connection between the cluster model and the AKLT state.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information is presented in this table?
choices: The central charges of various conformal field theories.
The effect of the Jordan-Wigner transformation on the central charge of phase transitions.
The phase transitions of the generalized cluster models.
A comparison of the central charges and edge degeneracies for the α-chain transitions to the trivial chain, both with and without interactions.
The central charges for the N-parafermion CFTs at the critical point between the trivial phase and the SPT phase with edge mode d = √N.
The connection between the central charge and the edge degeneracy for bosonic SPT phases.
The phase transitions of the generalized cluster models.
The effect of interactions on the central charges of phase transitions.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the topic of this table?
choices: The central charges for the unitary minimal CFTs at the critical point between the trivial phase and the SPT phase of SU(2)_k anyons.
The phase transitions of parafermionic chains.
The group structure of SPT phases.
The connection between the central charge and the number of Majorana modes.
The central charges for the CFTs at the critical point between the trivial phase and SPT phase protected by Z_n × Z_n with edge mode dimension d=n.
The phase transitions of SU(N) spin chains.
The effect of symmetry breaking on the central charge.
The central charges for the WZW SO(|α_0−α_1|)_1 field theories.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information is provided in this table?
choices: The central charges for WZW SU(2M)1 which likely describe the critical point between trivial phase and the SPT phase protected by SU(2M).
The phase transitions of the generalized cluster models.
The effect of interactions on the phase diagram of the Kitaev chain.
The different SPT phases characterized by fermionic parity symmetry and time-reversal symmetry.
The central charges of different α-chain models.
The phase factors characterizing the symmetry fractionalization of P and T for the α-chain, as defined in Eq. (A3).
The effect of the Jordan-Wigner transformation on the α-chain.
The mapping of the α-chain to different spin models.
